alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 23 at 1:40PM PST until January 26 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 8 to 12 feet with dangerous rip currents. Minor coastal flooding during morning high tides. * WHERE...Central Coast beaches of San Luis Obispo County and Santa Barbara Counties. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. Pooling of sea water is expected around the time of high tide over sandy beach areas including bike paths and walkways. Significant damage is NOT expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tides will peak near 6.3 to 6.8 feet each morning between 7 AM and 9 AM.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
